010import org.sbgn.ArcClazz;
011import org.sbgn.GlyphClazz;
012import org.sbgn.Language;
013import org.sbgn.SbgnUtil;
014import org.sbgn.bindings.*;
015import org.slf4j.Logger;
016import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
017//import org.w3c.dom.Document;
018//import org.w3c.dom.Element;

021import javax.xml.bind.JAXBException;

023//import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder;

032
033/**
034 * This class converts BioPAX L3 model into SBGN PD (SBGN-ML XML).
035 * It optionally applies a special COSE layout.
036 *
037 * Currently, this converter ignores several BioPAX types/properties:
038 * <ul>
039 * <li>Parent-child relationship between entity references</li>
040 * <li>Binding features and covalent binding features of physical entities</li>
041 * <li>Pathway, PathwayStep, Evidence, etc.</li>
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * Also note that:
045 * <ul>
046 * <li>Compartment is just a controlled vocabulary in BioPAX, so nesting and neighborhood relations
047 * between compartments are not handled here.</li>
048 * <li>Control structures in BioPAX and in SBGN PD are a little different. We use logical
049 * glyphs and arcs to approximate controls in BioPAX. However, in fact,
050 * BioPAX does not imply a logical operator between controllers.</li>
051 * </ul>
052 *
053 * @author Ozgun Babur
054 */
055public class L3ToSBGNPDConverter {
056        private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(L3ToSBGNPDConverter.class);
057
058        /*
059         * A matching between physical entities and SBGN classes.
060         */
061        private static Map<Class<? extends BioPAXElement>, String> typeMatchMap;
062
063        /*
064         * For creating SBGN objects.
065         */
066        private static ObjectFactory factory;
067
068        /*
069         * This class is used for detecting ubiques.
070         */
071        protected UbiqueDetector ubiqueDet;
072
073        /*
074         * This class is used for generating short printable strings (text in info boxes) from
075         * recognized entity features.
076         */
077        protected FeatureDecorator featStrGen;
078
079        /*
080         * Flag to run a layout before writing down the sbgn.(memberPhysicalEntity)
081         */
082        protected boolean doLayout;
083
084        /*
085         * If the number of nodes (biological processes and participants) in the model
086         * is going to be greater than this maximum, then no layout (but a trivial one)
087         * will be applied.
088         */
089        protected int maxNodes;
090
091        /*
092         * Mapping from SBGN IDs to the IDs of the related objects in BioPAX.
093         */
094        protected Map<String, Set<String>> sbgn2BPMap;
095
096        /*
097         * Option to flatten nested complexes.
098         */
099        protected boolean flattenComplexContent;
100
101        /*
102         * SBGN process glyph can be used to show reversible reactions. In that case two ports of the
103         * process will only have product glyphs. However, this creates an incompatibility with BioPAX:
104         * reversible biochemical reactions can have catalysis with a direction. But if we use a single
105         * glyph for the process and direct that catalysis to it, then the direction of the catalysis
106         * will be lost. If we use two process nodes for the reversible reaction (one for left-to-right
107         * and another for right-to-left), then we can direct the directed catalysis to only the
108         * relevant process glyph.
109         *
110         * Also note that the layout do not support ports. If layout is run, the ports are removed. In
111         * that case it will be impossible to distinguish left and right components of the reversible
112         * process glyph because they will all be product edges.
113         */
114        protected boolean useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion;
115
116        /*
117         * ID to glyph map.
118         */
119        Map<String, Glyph> glyphMap;
120
121        /*
122         * ID to Arc map
123         */
124        Map<String, Arc> arcMap;
125
126        /*
127         * ID to compartment map.
128         */
129        Map<String, Glyph> compartmentMap;
130
131        /*
132         * Set of ubiquitous molecules.
133         */
134        Set<Glyph> ubiqueSet;
135
136//      private static Document biopaxMetaDoc; //see issue #40
137
138        static {
139                factory = new ObjectFactory();
140                typeMatchMap = new HashMap<Class<? extends BioPAXElement>, String>();
141                typeMatchMap.put(Protein.class, GlyphClazz.MACROMOLECULE.getClazz());
142                typeMatchMap.put(SmallMolecule.class, GlyphClazz.SIMPLE_CHEMICAL.getClazz());
143                typeMatchMap.put(Dna.class, GlyphClazz.NUCLEIC_ACID_FEATURE.getClazz());
144                typeMatchMap.put(Rna.class, GlyphClazz.NUCLEIC_ACID_FEATURE.getClazz());
145                typeMatchMap.put(DnaRegion.class, GlyphClazz.NUCLEIC_ACID_FEATURE.getClazz());
146                typeMatchMap.put(RnaRegion.class, GlyphClazz.NUCLEIC_ACID_FEATURE.getClazz());
147                typeMatchMap.put(NucleicAcid.class, GlyphClazz.NUCLEIC_ACID_FEATURE.getClazz());
148                typeMatchMap.put(PhysicalEntity.class, GlyphClazz.UNSPECIFIED_ENTITY.getClazz());
149                //TODO: remove SimplePhysicalEntity.class key (- abstract type)?
150                typeMatchMap.put(SimplePhysicalEntity.class, GlyphClazz.UNSPECIFIED_ENTITY.getClazz());
151                typeMatchMap.put(Complex.class, GlyphClazz.COMPLEX.getClazz());
152                typeMatchMap.put(Gene.class, GlyphClazz.NUCLEIC_ACID_FEATURE.getClazz());
153
154//              //a document for adding metadata elements to insert into SBGN-ML PD glyphs (inside Extensions/Notes element).
155//              DocumentBuilderFactory dbf = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
156//              try {
157//                      DocumentBuilder db = dbf.newDocumentBuilder();
158//                      db.reset();
159//                      biopaxMetaDoc = db.newDocument();
160//              } catch (ParserConfigurationException e) {
161//                      throw new RuntimeException("Cannot initialize BioPAX extensions DOM.", e);
162//              }
163        }
164
165        /**
166         * Constructor.
167         */
168        public L3ToSBGNPDConverter() {
169                this(null, null, false);
170        }
171
172        /**
173         * Constructor with parameters.
174         * @param ubiqueDet Ubique detector class
175         * @param featStrGen feature string generator class
176         * @param doLayout whether we want to perform layout after SBGN creation.
177         */
178        public L3ToSBGNPDConverter(UbiqueDetector ubiqueDet, FeatureDecorator featStrGen, boolean doLayout)
179        {
180                this.ubiqueDet = ubiqueDet;
181                this.featStrGen = (featStrGen != null) ? featStrGen : new CommonFeatureStringGenerator();
182                this.doLayout = doLayout;
183                this.useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion = true;
184                this.sbgn2BPMap = new HashMap<String, Set<String>>();
185                this.flattenComplexContent = true;
186                this.maxNodes = 1000;
187        }
188
189        public void setDoLayout(boolean doLayout) {
190                this.doLayout = doLayout;
191        }
192
193        /**
194         * Getter class for the parameter useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion.
195         * @return whether use two glyphs for the reversible conversion
196         */
197        public boolean isUseTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion() {
198                return useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion;
199        }
200
201        /**
202         * Sets the option to use two glyphs for the reversible conversion.
203         * @param useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion give true if use two glyphs
204         */
205        public void setUseTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion(boolean useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion)
206        {
207                this.useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion = useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion;
208        }
209
210        public boolean isFlattenComplexContent() {
211                return flattenComplexContent;
212        }
213
214        public void setFlattenComplexContent(boolean flattenComplexContent) {
215                this.flattenComplexContent = flattenComplexContent;
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * Converts the given model to SBGN, and writes in the specified file.
220         *
221         * @param model model to convert
222         * @param file file to write
223         */
224        public void writeSBGN(Model model, String file) {
225                // Create the model
226                Sbgn sbgn = createSBGN(model);
227
228                // Write in file
229                try {
230                        SbgnUtil.writeToFile(sbgn, new File(file));
231                }
232                catch (JAXBException e) {
233                        throw new RuntimeException("writeSBGN, SbgnUtil.writeToFile failed", e);
234                }
235        }
236
237        /**
238         * Converts the given model to SBGN, and writes in the specified output stream.
239         *
240         * @param model model to convert
241         * @param stream output stream to write
242         */
243        public void writeSBGN(Model model, OutputStream stream) {
244                Sbgn sbgn = createSBGN(model);
245                try {
246                        JAXBContext context = JAXBContext.newInstance("org.sbgn.bindings");
247                        Marshaller marshaller = context.createMarshaller();
248                        marshaller.setProperty(Marshaller.JAXB_FORMATTED_OUTPUT, Boolean.TRUE);
249                        marshaller.marshal(sbgn, stream);
250                } catch (JAXBException e) {
251                        throw new RuntimeException("writeSBGN: JAXB marshalling failed", e);
252                }
253        }
254
255        /**
256         * Creates an SBGN object from the given BioPAX L3 model.
257         *
258         * Currently, it converts physical entities (interaction participants)
259         * and Conversion, Control, including their sub-classes, TemplateReaction,
260         * MolecularInteraction, GeneticInteraction, and base Interaction.class types.
261         * I does not convert other BioPAX entities and utility classes, such as:
262         * Pathway, Evidence, PathwayStep.
263         *
264         * @param model model to convert to SBGN
265         * @return SBGN representation of the BioPAX model
266         */
267        public Sbgn createSBGN(Model model) {
268                assert model.getLevel().equals(BioPAXLevel.L3) : "This method only supports L3 graphs";
269
270                glyphMap = new HashMap<String, Glyph>();
271                compartmentMap = new HashMap<String, Glyph>();
272                arcMap = new HashMap<String, Arc>();
273                ubiqueSet = new HashSet<Glyph>();
274
275                int n = 0; //approximate number of SBGN nodes
276
277                // Create glyphs for Physical Entities
278                for (Entity entity : model.getObjects(Entity.class)) {
279                        if (needsToBeCreatedInitially(entity)) {
280                                createGlyph(entity);
281                                ++n;
282                        }
283                }
284
285                // Create glyph for conversions and link with arcs
286                for (Interaction interaction : model.getObjects(Interaction.class))
287                {
288                        if(interaction.getParticipant().isEmpty())
289                                continue;
290
291                        // For each conversion we check if we need to create a left-to-right and/or right-to-left process.
292                        if(interaction instanceof Conversion) {
293                                Conversion conv = (Conversion) interaction;
294                                if (conv.getConversionDirection() == null ||
295                                                conv.getConversionDirection().equals(ConversionDirectionType.LEFT_TO_RIGHT) ||
296                                                (conv.getConversionDirection().equals(ConversionDirectionType.REVERSIBLE) &&
297                                                                useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion)) {
298                                        createProcessAndConnections(conv, ConversionDirectionType.LEFT_TO_RIGHT);
299                                } else if (conv.getConversionDirection() != null &&
300                                                (conv.getConversionDirection().equals(ConversionDirectionType.RIGHT_TO_LEFT) ||
301                                                                (conv.getConversionDirection().equals(ConversionDirectionType.REVERSIBLE)) &&
302                                                                                useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion)) {
303                                        createProcessAndConnections(conv, ConversionDirectionType.RIGHT_TO_LEFT);
304                                } else if (conv.getConversionDirection() != null &&
305                                                conv.getConversionDirection().equals(ConversionDirectionType.REVERSIBLE) &&
306                                                !useTwoGlyphsForReversibleConversion) {
307                                        createProcessAndConnections(conv, ConversionDirectionType.REVERSIBLE);
308                                }
309                        } else if(interaction instanceof TemplateReaction) {
310                                createProcessAndConnections((TemplateReaction) interaction);
311                        } else if(interaction instanceof MolecularInteraction) {
312                                createBasicProcess(interaction);
313                        } else if(interaction instanceof GeneticInteraction) {
314                                createGiProcess((GeneticInteraction) interaction);
315                        } else if(!(interaction instanceof Control)) {
316                                createBasicProcess(interaction);
317                        } else { //a Control special case, because these are normally added inside the methods in cases above
318                                Control control = (Control) interaction;
319                                //Control without any controlled process but with controller and controlledOf
320                                if(control.getControlled()==null || control.getControlled().isEmpty()) {
321                                        Glyph g = createControlStructure(control);
322                                        processControllers(control.getControlledOf(), g);
323                                }//else - do nothing - as it's converted anyway when the controlled interactions are processed
324                        }
325
326                        ++n;
327                }
328
329                // Register created objects into sbgn construct
330                final Sbgn sbgn = factory.createSbgn();
331                org.sbgn.bindings.Map map = new org.sbgn.bindings.Map();
332                sbgn.setMap(map);
333                map.setLanguage(Language.PD.toString());
334                map.getGlyph().addAll(getRootGlyphs(glyphMap.values()));
335                map.getGlyph().addAll(getRootGlyphs(ubiqueSet));
336                map.getGlyph().addAll(compartmentMap.values());
337                map.getArc().addAll(arcMap.values());
338
339//    //Store some metadata within the standard SBGN-ML extension element: Notes
340//              biopaxMetaDoc.setDocumentURI(model.getUri()); //can be null
341//              SBGNBase.Notes modelNotes = new SBGNBase.Notes();
342//              sbgn.setNotes(modelNotes);
343//              Element elt = biopaxMetaDoc.createElementNS("","metadata");
344//              elt.setTextContent(String.format("{name:\"%s\",uri:\"%s\"}", model.getName(), model.getUri())
345//                      .replaceAll("null",""));
346//              modelNotes.getAny().add(elt);
347
348                final boolean layout = doLayout && n < this.maxNodes && !arcMap.isEmpty();
349                try {
350                        //Must call this, although actual layout might never run;
351                        //in some real data tests, skipping createLayout method
352                        //led to malformed SBGN model, unfortunately...
353                        (new SBGNLayoutManager()).createLayout(sbgn, layout);
354                } catch (Exception e) {
355                        throw new RuntimeException("SBGN Layout of " + model.getXmlBase()
356                                        + ((model.getName()==null) ? "" : model.getName()) + " failed.", e);
357                }
358                if(!layout) log.warn(String.format("No layout, for either " +
359                                "it's disabled: %s, or ~ no. nodes > %s: %s, or - no edges: %s",
360                                !doLayout, maxNodes, n>maxNodes, arcMap.isEmpty()));
361
362                return sbgn; //modified sbgn (even when no layout is run)
363        }
364
365        // Associate all the controllers of this process;
366        private void processControllers(Set<Control> controls, Glyph process) {
367                for (Control ctrl : controls) {
368                        Glyph g = createControlStructure(ctrl); //if ctrl has upstream controls (modulations), they're processed as well
369                        if (g != null) {
370                                createArc(g, process, getControlType(ctrl), null);
371                                processControllers(ctrl.getControlledOf(), g);
372                        }
373                }
374        }
375
376        /*
377         * Initially, we don't want to represent every PhysicalEntity or Gene node.
378         * For example, if a Complex is nested under another Complex,
379         * and if it is not a participant of any interaction,
380         * then we don't want to draw it separately; also skip for dangling entities.
381         *
382         * @param ent physical entity or gene (it returns false for other entity types) to test
383         * @return true if we want to draw this entity in SBGN; false - otherwise, or - to be auto-created later
384         */
385        private boolean needsToBeCreatedInitially(Entity ent) {
386                boolean create = false;
387
388                if(ent instanceof PhysicalEntity || ent instanceof Gene) {
389                        if(ubiqueDet != null && ubiqueDet.isUbique(ent))
390                                create = false; // ubiques will be created where they are actually used.
391                        else if (!ent.getParticipantOf().isEmpty())
392                                create = true;
393                        else if(ent instanceof Complex && ((Complex) ent).getComponentOf().isEmpty()
394                                        && ((Complex) ent).getMemberPhysicalEntityOf().isEmpty())
395                                create = true; //do make a root/top complex despite it's dangling
396                }
397
398                return create;
399        }
400
401        /*
402         * Creates a glyph representing the given PhysicalEntity.
403         *
404         * @param e PhysicalEntity or Gene to represent
405         * @return the created glyph
406         */
407        private Glyph createGlyph(Entity e)
408        {
409                String id = convertID(e.getUri());
410                if (glyphMap.containsKey(id))
411                        return glyphMap.get(id);
412
413                // Create its glyph and register
414                Glyph g = createGlyphBasics(e, true);
415                glyphMap.put(g.getId(), g);
416
417                //TODO: export metadata (e.g., from bpe.getAnnotations() map) using the SBGN Extension feature
418//              SBGNBase.Extension ext = new SBGNBase.Extension();
419//              g.setExtension(ext);
420//              Element el = biopaxMetaDoc.createElement(e.getModelInterface().getSimpleName());
421//              el.setAttribute("uri", e.getUri());
422//              ext.getAny().add(el);
423
424                if (g.getClone() != null)
425                        ubiqueSet.add(g);
426
427                if(e instanceof PhysicalEntity) {
428                        PhysicalEntity pe = (PhysicalEntity) e;
429                        assignLocation(pe, g);
430                        if("or".equalsIgnoreCase(g.getClazz())) {
431                                buildGeneric(pe, g, null);
432                        } else if (pe instanceof Complex) {
433                                createComplexContent((Complex) pe, g);
434                        }
435                }
436
437                return g;
438        }
439
440        /*
441         * Assigns compartmentRef of the glyph.
442         * @param pe Related PhysicalEntity
443         * @param g the glyph
444         */
445        private void assignLocation(PhysicalEntity pe, Glyph g) {
446                // Create compartment -- add this inside the compartment
447                Glyph loc = getCompartment(pe);
448                if (loc != null) {
449                        g.setCompartmentRef(loc);
450                }
451        }
452
453        /*
454         * This method creates a glyph for the given PhysicalEntity, sets its title and state variables
455         * if applicable.
456         *
457         * @param e PhysicalEntity or Gene to represent
458         * @param idIsFinal if ID is final, then it is recorded for future reference
459         * @return the glyph
460         */
461        private Glyph createGlyphBasics(Entity e, boolean idIsFinal)
462        {
463                Glyph g = factory.createGlyph();
464                g.setId(convertID(e.getUri()));
465
466                String s = typeMatchMap.get(e.getModelInterface());
467                if(( //use 'or' sbgn class for special generic physical entities
468                        e instanceof Complex && !((Complex)e).getMemberPhysicalEntity().isEmpty()
469                                && ((Complex) e).getComponent().isEmpty())
470                        ||
471                        (e instanceof SimplePhysicalEntity && ((SimplePhysicalEntity) e).getEntityReference()==null
472                                && !((SimplePhysicalEntity) e).getMemberPhysicalEntity().isEmpty()))
473                {
474                        s = GlyphClazz.OR.getClazz();
475                }
476                g.setClazz(s);
477
478                // Set the label
479                Label label = factory.createLabel();
480                label.setText(findLabelFor(e));
481                g.setLabel(label);
482
483                // Detect if ubique
484                if (ubiqueDet != null && ubiqueDet.isUbique(e))
485                {
486                        g.setClone(factory.createGlyphClone());
487                }
488
489                // Put on state variables
490                if (!g.getClazz().equals(GlyphClazz.OR.getClazz())) {
491                        g.getGlyph().addAll(getInformation(e));
492                }
493
494                // Record the mapping
495                if (idIsFinal) {
496                        Set<String> uris = new HashSet<String>();
497                        uris.add(e.getUri());
498                        sbgn2BPMap.put(g.getId(), uris);
499                }
500
501                return g;
502        }
503
504        /*
505         * Gets the representing glyph of the PhysicalEntity or Gene.
506         * @param e PhysicalEntity or Gene to get its glyph
507         * @param linkID Edge id, used if the Entity is ubique
508         * @return Representing glyph
509         */
510        private Glyph getGlyphToLink(Entity e, String linkID)
511        {
512                if (ubiqueDet == null || !ubiqueDet.isUbique(e))
513                {
514                        return glyphMap.get(convertID(e.getUri()));
515                }
516                else {
517                        // Create a new glyph for each use of ubique
518                        Glyph g = createGlyphBasics(e, false);
519                        g.setId(convertID(e.getUri()) + "_" + ModelUtils.md5hex(linkID));
520                        Set<String> uris = new HashSet<String>();
521                        uris.add(e.getUri());
522                        sbgn2BPMap.put(g.getId(), uris);
523                        if(e instanceof PhysicalEntity && ((PhysicalEntity)e).getCellularLocation() != null) {
524                                assignLocation((PhysicalEntity) e, g);
525                        }
526                        ubiqueSet.add(g);
527                        return g;
528                }
529        }
530        
531        /*
532         * Fills in the content of a complex.
533         *
534         * @param cx Complex to be filled
535         * @param cg its glyph
536         */
537        private void createComplexContent(Complex cx, Glyph cg)
538        {
539                if (flattenComplexContent)
540                {
541                        for (PhysicalEntity mem : getFlattenedMembers(cx))
542                        {
543                                createComplexMember(mem, cg);
544                        }
545                }
546                else {
547                        for (PhysicalEntity mem : cx.getComponent())
548                        {
549                                if (mem instanceof Complex)
550                                {
551                                        addComplexAsMember((Complex) mem, cg);
552                                }
553                                else
554                                {
555                                        createComplexMember(mem, cg);
556                                }
557                        }
558                }
559        }
560
561        private void buildGeneric(PhysicalEntity generic, Glyph or, Glyph container) {
562                assert "or".equalsIgnoreCase(or.getClazz()) : "must be 'or' glyph class";
563
564                for (PhysicalEntity m : generic.getMemberPhysicalEntity())
565                {
566                        Glyph g = createGlyphBasics(m,false);
567                        if(container!=null)
568                                container.getGlyph().add(g);
569                        String gid = g.getId() + "_" + ModelUtils.md5hex("memberof_" + or.getId());
570                        g.setId(gid);
571                        glyphMap.put(gid, g);
572                        Set<String> uris =  new HashSet<String>();
573                        uris.add(m.getUri());
574                        sbgn2BPMap.put(gid, uris);
575                        assignLocation(m, g);
576                        createArc(g, or, ArcClazz.LOGIC_ARC.getClazz(), null);
577                        if(m instanceof Complex)
578                                createComplexContent((Complex) m, g);
579                }
580        }
581
582
583        /*
584         * Recursive method for creating the content of a complex. A complex may contain other complexes
585         * (bad practice), but SBGN needs them flattened. If an inner complex is empty, then we
586         * represent it using a glyph. Otherwise we represent only the members of this inner complex,
587         * merging them with the most outer complex.
588         *
589         * @param cx inner complex to add as member
590         * @param container glyph for most outer complex
591         */
592        private void addComplexAsMember(Complex cx, Glyph container) {
593                // Create a glyph for the inner complex
594                Glyph inner = createComplexMember(cx, container);
595
596                for (PhysicalEntity mem : cx.getComponent())
597                {
598                        if (mem instanceof Complex)
599                        {
600                                // Recursive call for inner complexes
601                                addComplexAsMember((Complex) mem, inner);
602                        }
603                        else
604                        {
605                                createComplexMember(mem, inner);
606                        }
607                }
608        }
609
610        /*
611         * Gets the members of the Complex that needs to be displayed in a flattened view.
612         * @param cx to get members
613         * @return members to display
614         */
615        private Set<PhysicalEntity> getFlattenedMembers(Complex cx) {
616                Set<PhysicalEntity> set = new HashSet<PhysicalEntity>();
617                for (PhysicalEntity mem : cx.getComponent()) {
618                        if (mem instanceof Complex) {
619                                if (!hasNonComplexMember((Complex) mem)) {
620                                        set.add(mem);
621                                } else {
622                                        set.addAll(getFlattenedMembers((Complex) mem));
623                                }
624                        } else set.add(mem);
625                }
626
627                return set;
628        }
629
630        /*
631         * Checks if a Complex contains any PhysicalEntity member which is not a Complex.
632         * @param cx to check
633         * @return true if there is a non-complex member
634         */
635        private boolean hasNonComplexMember(Complex cx) {
636                for (PhysicalEntity mem : cx.getComponent()) {
637                        if (!(mem instanceof Complex) || hasNonComplexMember((Complex) mem)) {
638                                return true;
639                        }
640                }
641                return false;
642        }
643
644        /*
645         * Creates a glyph for the complex member.
646         *
647         * @param pe PhysicalEntity to represent as complex member
648         * @param container Glyph for the complex shell
649         */
650        private Glyph createComplexMember(PhysicalEntity pe, Glyph container) {
651                Glyph g = createGlyphBasics(pe, false);
652                container.getGlyph().add(g);
653
654                // A PhysicalEntity may appear in many complexes -- we identify the member using its complex
655                g.setId(g.getId() + "_" + ModelUtils.md5hex(container.getId()));
656                glyphMap.put(g.getId(), g);
657
658                Set<String> uris =  new HashSet<String>();
659                uris.add(pe.getUri());
660                sbgn2BPMap.put(g.getId(), uris);
661
662                if("or".equalsIgnoreCase(g.getClazz())) {
663                        buildGeneric(pe, g, container);
664                }
665
666                return g;
667        }
668
669        /*
670         * Looks for the display name of this PhysicalEntity. If there is none, then it looks for the
671         * display name of its EntityReference. If still no name at hand, it tries the standard
672         * name, and then first element in name lists.
673         *
674         * A good BioPAX file will use a short and specific name (like HGNC symbols) as displayName.
675         *
676         * @param pe PhysicalEntity or Gene to find a name
677         * @return a name for labeling
678         */
679        private String findLabelFor(Entity pe) {
680                // Use gene symbol of PE
681                for (Xref xref : pe.getXref()) {
682                        String sym = extractGeneSymbol(xref);
683                        if (sym != null) return sym;
684                }
685
686                // Use gene symbol of ER
687                EntityReference er = null;
688
689                if (pe instanceof SimplePhysicalEntity) {
690                        er = ((SimplePhysicalEntity) pe).getEntityReference();
691                }
692
693                if (er != null) {
694                        for (Xref xref : er.getXref()) {
695                                String sym = extractGeneSymbol(xref);
696                                if (sym != null) return sym;
697                        }
698                }
699                
700                // Use display name of entity
701                String name = pe.getDisplayName();
702
703                if (name == null || name.trim().isEmpty())
704                {
705                        if (er != null) {
706                                name = er.getDisplayName();
707                        }
708
709                        if (name == null || name.trim().isEmpty()) {
710                                name = pe.getStandardName();
711                                if (name == null || name.trim().isEmpty()) {
712                                        if (er != null) {
713                                                name = er.getStandardName();
714                                        }
715                                        if (name == null || name.trim().isEmpty()) {
716                                                if (!pe.getName().isEmpty()) {
717                                                        // Use first name of entity
718                                                        name = pe.getName().iterator().next();
719                                                } else if (er != null && !er.getName().isEmpty()) {
720                                                        // Use first name of reference
721                                                        name = er.getName().iterator().next();
722                                                }
723                                        }
724                                }
725                        }
726                }
727
728                // Search for the shortest name of chemicals
729                if (pe instanceof SmallMolecule) {
730                        String shortName = getShortestName((SmallMolecule) pe);
731                        if (shortName != null) {
732                                if (name == null || (shortName.length() < name.length() && !shortName.isEmpty())) {
733                                        name = shortName;
734                                }
735                        }
736                }
737                
738                if (name == null || name.trim().isEmpty()) {
739                        // Don't leave it without a name
740                        name = "noname";
741                }
742
743                return name;
744        }
745
746        /*
747         * Searches for the shortest name of the PhysicalEntity.
748         * @param spe entity to search in
749         * @return the shortest name
750         */
751        private String getShortestName(SimplePhysicalEntity spe)
752        {
753                String name = null;
754
755                for (String s : spe.getName()) {
756                        if (name == null || s.length() > name.length()) name = s;
757                }
758
759                EntityReference er = spe.getEntityReference();
760                
761                if (er != null) {
762                        for (String s : er.getName()) {
763                                if (name == null || s.length() > name.length()) name = s;                               
764                        }
765                }
766
767                return name;
768        }
769
770        /**
771         * Searches for gene symbol in Xref.
772         * @param xref Xref to search
773         * @return gene symbol
774         */
775        private String extractGeneSymbol(Xref xref)
776        {
777                if (xref.getDb() != null && (
778                        xref.getDb().equalsIgnoreCase("HGNC Symbol") ||
779                        xref.getDb().equalsIgnoreCase("Gene Symbol") ||
780                        xref.getDb().equalsIgnoreCase("HGNC")))
781                {
782                        String ref = xref.getId();
783
784                        if (ref != null) {
785                                ref = ref.trim();
786                                if (ref.contains(":")) ref = ref.substring(ref.indexOf(":") + 1);
787                                if (ref.contains("_")) ref = ref.substring(ref.indexOf("_") + 1);
788                                // if the reference is an HGNC ID, then convert it to a symbol
789                                if (!HGNC.containsSymbol(ref) && Character.isDigit(ref.charAt(0))) {
790                                        ref = HGNC.getSymbol(ref);
791                                }
792                        }
793
794                        return ref;
795                }
796
797                return null;
798        }
799        
800        /*
801         * Adds molecule type, and iterates over features of the entity and creates corresponding state
802         * variables. Ignores binding features and covalent-binding features.
803         * 
804         * @param e entity or gene to collect features
805         * @return list of state variables
806         */
807        private List<Glyph> getInformation(Entity e) {
808                List<Glyph> list = new ArrayList<Glyph>();
809
810                // Add the molecule type before states if this is a nucleic acid or gene
811                if (e instanceof NucleicAcid || e instanceof Gene) {
812                        Glyph g = factory.createGlyph();
813                        g.setClazz(GlyphClazz.UNIT_OF_INFORMATION.getClazz());
814                        Label label = factory.createLabel();
815                        String s;
816                        if(e instanceof Dna)
817                                s = "mt:DNA";
818                        else if(e instanceof DnaRegion)
819                                s = "ct:DNA";
820                        else if(e instanceof Rna)
821                                s = "mt:RNA";
822                        else if(e instanceof RnaRegion)
823                                s = "ct:RNA";
824                        else if(e instanceof Gene)
825                                s = "ct:gene";
826                        else
827                                s = "mt:NuclAc";
828
829                        label.setText(s);
830                        g.setLabel(label);
831                        list.add(g);
832                }
833
834                // Extract state variables
835                if(e instanceof PhysicalEntity) {
836                        PhysicalEntity pe = (PhysicalEntity) e;
837                        extractFeatures(pe.getFeature(), true, list);
838                        extractFeatures(pe.getNotFeature(), false, list);
839                }
840
841                return list;
842        }
843
844        /*
845         * Converts the features in the given feature set. Adds a "!" in front of NOT features.
846         *
847         * @param features feature set
848         * @param normalFeature specifies the type of features -- normal feature = true,
849         *                NOT feature = false
850         * @param list state variables
851         */
852        private void extractFeatures(Set<EntityFeature> features, boolean normalFeature,
853                List<Glyph> list)
854        {
855                for (EntityFeature feature : features) {
856                        if (feature instanceof ModificationFeature || feature instanceof FragmentFeature) {
857                                Glyph stvar = factory.createGlyph();
858                                stvar.setClazz(GlyphClazz.STATE_VARIABLE.getClazz());
859                                Glyph.State state = featStrGen.createStateVar(feature, factory);
860                                if (state != null) {
861                                        // Add a "!" in front of NOT features
862                                        if (!normalFeature) {
863                                                state.setValue("!" + state.getValue());
864                                        }
865                                        stvar.setState(state);
866                                        list.add(stvar);
867                                }
868                        }
869                }
870        }
871
872        private Glyph getCompartment(String name) {
873                if (name == null || name.isEmpty())
874                        return null;
875
876                name = name.toLowerCase().trim();
877                final String id = name.replaceAll("\\s+","_");
878                Glyph comp = compartmentMap.get(id);
879
880                if (comp == null) {
881                        //create a new compartment glyph and store in the map
882                        comp = factory.createGlyph();
883                        comp.setId(id);
884                        comp.setClazz(GlyphClazz.COMPARTMENT.getClazz());
885                        Label label = factory.createLabel();
886                        comp.setLabel(label);
887                        label.setText(name);
888                        compartmentMap.put(id, comp);
889                }
890
891                return comp;
892        }
893
894        /*
895         * Gets the compartment of the given PhysicalEntity.
896         *
897         * @param pe PhysicalEntity to look for its compartment
898         * @return name of compartment or null if there is none
899         */
900        private Glyph getCompartment(PhysicalEntity pe) {
901                CellularLocationVocabulary cl = pe.getCellularLocation();
902                if (cl != null && !cl.getTerm().isEmpty()) {
903                        String name = null;
904                        // get a cv term,
905                        // ignoring IDs (should not be there but happens)
906                        for(String term : cl.getTerm()) {
907                                term = term.toLowerCase();
908                                if(!term.matches("(go|so|mi|bto|cl|pato|mod):")) {
909                                 name = term;
910                                 break;
911                                }
912                        }
913                        return getCompartment(name);
914                } else
915                        return null;
916        }
917
918        /*
919         * Creates a representation for Conversion.
920         *
921         * @param cnv the conversion
922         * @param direction direction of the conversion to create
923         */
924        private void createProcessAndConnections(Conversion cnv, ConversionDirectionType direction)
925        {
926                assert cnv.getConversionDirection() == null ||
927                        cnv.getConversionDirection().equals(direction) ||
928                        cnv.getConversionDirection().equals(ConversionDirectionType.REVERSIBLE);
929
930                // create the process for the conversion in that direction
931                Glyph process = factory.createGlyph();
932                process.setClazz(GlyphClazz.PROCESS.getClazz());
933                process.setId(convertID(cnv.getUri()) + "_" + direction.name().replaceAll("_",""));
934                glyphMap.put(process.getId(), process);
935
936                // Determine input and output sets
937                Set<PhysicalEntity> input = direction.equals(ConversionDirectionType.RIGHT_TO_LEFT) ?
938                        cnv.getRight() : cnv.getLeft();
939                Set<PhysicalEntity> output = direction.equals(ConversionDirectionType.RIGHT_TO_LEFT) ?
940                        cnv.getLeft() : cnv.getRight();
941
942                // Create input and outputs ports for the process
943                addPorts(process);
944                Map<PhysicalEntity, Stoichiometry> stoic = getStoichiometry(cnv);
945
946                // Associate inputs to input port
947                for (PhysicalEntity pe : input) {
948                        Glyph g = getGlyphToLink(pe, process.getId());
949                        createArc(g, process.getPort().get(0), direction == ConversionDirectionType.REVERSIBLE ?
950                                ArcClazz.PRODUCTION.getClazz() : ArcClazz.CONSUMPTION.getClazz(), stoic.get(pe));
951                }
952
953                // Associate outputs to output port
954                for (PhysicalEntity pe : output) {
955                        Glyph g = getGlyphToLink(pe, process.getId());
956                        createArc(process.getPort().get(1), g, ArcClazz.PRODUCTION.getClazz(), stoic.get(pe));
957                }
958
959                processControllers(cnv.getControlledOf(), process);
960
961                // Record mapping
962                Set<String> uris = new HashSet<String>();
963                uris.add(cnv.getUri());
964                sbgn2BPMap.put(process.getId(), uris);
965        }
966
967        /*
968         * Gets the map of stoichiometry coefficients of participants.
969         * @param conv the conversion
970         * @return map from physical entities to their stoichiometry
971         */
972        private Map<PhysicalEntity, Stoichiometry> getStoichiometry(Conversion conv) {
973                Map<PhysicalEntity, Stoichiometry> map = new HashMap<PhysicalEntity, Stoichiometry>();
974
975                for (Stoichiometry stoc : conv.getParticipantStoichiometry())
976                        map.put(stoc.getPhysicalEntity(), stoc);
977
978                return map;
979        }
980
981        /*
982         * Creates a representation for TemplateReaction.
983         *
984         * @param tr template reaction
985         */
986        private void createProcessAndConnections(TemplateReaction tr) {
987                // create the process for the reaction
988                Glyph process = factory.createGlyph();
989                process.setClazz(GlyphClazz.PROCESS.getClazz());
990                process.setId(convertID(tr.getUri()));
991                glyphMap.put(process.getId(), process);
992
993                final Set<PhysicalEntity> products = tr.getProduct();
994                final Set<PhysicalEntity> participants = new HashSet<PhysicalEntity>( //new modifiable set
995                                new ClassFilterSet<Entity,PhysicalEntity>(tr.getParticipant(), PhysicalEntity.class));
996
997                // link products, if any
998                // ('participant' property is there defined sometimes instead of or in addition to 'product' or 'template')
999                for (PhysicalEntity pe : products) {
1000                        Glyph g = getGlyphToLink(pe, process.getId());
1001                        createArc(process, g, ArcClazz.PRODUCTION.getClazz(), null);
1002                        participants.remove(pe);
1003                }
1004
1005                // link template, if present
1006                PhysicalEntity template = tr.getTemplate();
1007                if(template != null) {
1008                        Glyph g = getGlyphToLink(template, process.getId());
1009                        createArc(g, process, ArcClazz.CONSUMPTION.getClazz(), null);
1010                        participants.remove(template);
1011                } else if(participants.isEmpty()) {
1012                        //when no template is defined and cannot be inferred, create a source-and-sink as the input
1013                        Glyph sas = factory.createGlyph();
1014                        sas.setClazz(GlyphClazz.SOURCE_AND_SINK.getClazz());
1015                        sas.setId("unknown-template_" + ModelUtils.md5hex(process.getId()));
1016                        glyphMap.put(sas.getId(), sas);
1017                        createArc(sas, process, ArcClazz.CONSUMPTION.getClazz(), null);
1018                }
1019
1020                //infer input or output type arc for the rest of participants
1021                for (PhysicalEntity pe : participants) {
1022                        Glyph g = getGlyphToLink(pe, process.getId());
1023                        if(template==null)
1024                                createArc(g, process, ArcClazz.CONSUMPTION.getClazz(), null);
1025                        else
1026                                createArc(process, g, ArcClazz.PRODUCTION.getClazz(), null);
1027                }
1028                // Associate controllers
1029                processControllers(tr.getControlledOf(), process);
1030                // Record mapping
1031                sbgn2BPMap.put(process.getId(), new HashSet<String>(Collections.singleton(tr.getUri())));
1032        }
1033
1034        private void createBasicProcess(Interaction interaction) {
1035                // create the process for the conversion in that direction
1036                Glyph process = factory.createGlyph();
1037                process.setClazz(GlyphClazz.PROCESS.getClazz());
1038                process.setId(convertID(interaction.getUri()));
1039                glyphMap.put(process.getId(), process);
1040                // Associate participants
1041                for (PhysicalEntity pe : new ClassFilterSet<Entity,PhysicalEntity>(interaction.getParticipant(), PhysicalEntity.class)) {
1042                        Glyph g = getGlyphToLink(pe, process.getId());
1043                        createArc(g, process, ArcClazz.CONSUMPTION.getClazz(), null);
1044                }
1045                // Record mapping
1046                sbgn2BPMap.put(process.getId(), new HashSet<String>(Collections.singleton(interaction.getUri())));
1047                // Associate controllers
1048                processControllers(interaction.getControlledOf(), process);
1049        }
1050
1051        private void createGiProcess(GeneticInteraction interaction) {
1052                // create the process for the conversion in that direction
1053                Glyph process = factory.createGlyph();
1054                process.setClazz(GlyphClazz.AND.getClazz());
1055                process.setId(convertID(interaction.getUri()));
1056                glyphMap.put(process.getId(), process);
1057
1058                PhenotypeVocabulary v = interaction.getPhenotype();
1059                if(v != null && !v.getTerm().isEmpty()) {
1060                        String term = v.getTerm().iterator().next().toLowerCase().trim();
1061                        String id = convertID(term);
1062                        Glyph g = glyphMap.get(id);
1063                        if(g == null) {
1064                                g = factory.createGlyph();
1065                                g.setId(id);
1066                                g.setClazz(GlyphClazz.PHENOTYPE.getClazz());
1067                                Label label = factory.createLabel();
1068                                label.setText(term);
1069                                g.setLabel(label);
1070                                glyphMap.put(g.getId(), g);
1071                        }
1072                        createArc(process, g, ArcClazz.STIMULATION.getClazz(), null);
1073                }
1074                // Associate participants
1075                for (Entity e : interaction.getParticipant()) {
1076                        Glyph g = getGlyphToLink(e, process.getId());
1077                        createArc(g, process, ArcClazz.LOGIC_ARC.getClazz(), null);
1078                }
1079                // Record mapping
1080                sbgn2BPMap.put(process.getId(), new HashSet<String>(Collections.singleton(interaction.getUri())));
1081                // Associate controllers
1082                processControllers(interaction.getControlledOf(), process);
1083        }
1084
1085        /*
1086         * Creates or gets the glyph to connect to the control arc.
1087         *
1088         * @param ctrl Control to represent
1089         * @return glyph representing the controller tree
1090         */
1091        private Glyph createControlStructure(Control ctrl) {
1092                Glyph cg;
1093                Set<PhysicalEntity> controllers = getControllers(ctrl);
1094                // If no representable controller found, skip this control
1095                if (controllers.isEmpty()) {
1096                        cg = null;
1097                } else if (controllers.size() == 1 && getControllerSize(ctrl.getControlledOf()) == 0)
1098                { // If there is only one controller with no modulator, put an arc for controller
1099                        cg = getGlyphToLink(controllers.iterator().next(), convertID(ctrl.getUri()));
1100                } else {
1101                        // This list will contain handles for each participant of the AND structure
1102                        List<Glyph> toConnect = new ArrayList<Glyph>();
1103
1104                        // Bundle controllers if necessary
1105                        Glyph gg = handlePEGroup(controllers, convertID(ctrl.getUri()));
1106                        if(gg != null)
1107                                toConnect.add(gg);
1108
1109                        // Handle co-factors of catalysis
1110                        if (ctrl instanceof Catalysis) {
1111                                Set<PhysicalEntity> cofs = ((Catalysis) ctrl).getCofactor();
1112                                Glyph g = handlePEGroup(cofs, convertID(ctrl.getUri()));
1113                                if (g != null) 
1114                                        toConnect.add(g);
1115                        }
1116
1117                        if (toConnect.isEmpty()) {
1118                                return null;
1119                        } else if (toConnect.size() == 1) {
1120                                cg = toConnect.iterator().next();
1121                        } else {
1122                                cg = connectWithAND(toConnect);
1123                        }
1124                }
1125
1126                return cg;
1127        }
1128
1129        /*
1130         * Prepares the necessary construct for adding the given PhysicalEntity set to the Control
1131         * being drawn.
1132         *
1133         * @param pes entities to use in control
1134         * @return the glyph to connect to the appropriate place
1135         */
1136        private Glyph handlePEGroup(Set<PhysicalEntity> pes, String context) {
1137                int sz = pes.size();            
1138                if (sz > 1) {
1139                        List<Glyph> gs = getGlyphsOfPEs(pes, context);
1140                        return connectWithAND(gs);
1141                } else if (sz == 1) {
1142                        PhysicalEntity pe = pes.iterator().next();
1143                        if(glyphMap.containsKey(convertID(pe.getUri())))
1144                                return getGlyphToLink(pe, context);
1145                }
1146                
1147                //'pes' was empty
1148                return null;
1149        }
1150        
1151        /*
1152         * Gets the glyphs of the given set of PhysicalEntity objects. Does not create anything.
1153         *
1154         * @param pes entities to get their glyphs
1155         * @return glyphs of entities
1156         */
1157        private List<Glyph> getGlyphsOfPEs(Set<PhysicalEntity> pes, String context) {
1158                List<Glyph> gs = new ArrayList<Glyph>();
1159
1160                for (PhysicalEntity pe : pes)
1161                        if (glyphMap.containsKey(convertID(pe.getUri())))
1162                                gs.add(getGlyphToLink(pe, context));
1163
1164                return gs;
1165        }
1166
1167        /*
1168         * Creates an AND glyph downstream of the given glyphs.
1169         *
1170         * @param gs upstream glyph list
1171         * @return AND glyph
1172         */
1173        private Glyph connectWithAND(List<Glyph> gs) {
1174                // Compose an ID for the AND glyph
1175                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1176                Iterator<Glyph> iterator = gs.iterator();
1177                if(iterator.hasNext())
1178                    sb.append(iterator.next());
1179
1180                while (iterator.hasNext())
1181                        sb.append("-AND-").append(iterator.next().getId());
1182
1183                String id = ModelUtils.md5hex(sb.toString()); //shorten a very long id
1184
1185                // Create the AND glyph if not exists
1186                Glyph and = glyphMap.get(id);
1187                if (and == null) {
1188                        and = factory.createGlyph();
1189                        and.setClazz(GlyphClazz.AND.getClazz());
1190                        and.setId(id);
1191                        glyphMap.put(and.getId(), and);
1192                }
1193
1194                // Connect upstream to the AND glyph
1195                for (Glyph g : gs)
1196                        createArc(g, and, ArcClazz.LOGIC_ARC.getClazz(), null);
1197
1198                return and;
1199        }
1200
1201        /*
1202         * Converts the control type of the Control to the SBGN classes.
1203         *
1204         * @param ctrl Control to get its type
1205         * @return SBGN type of the Control
1206         */
1207        private String getControlType(Control ctrl) {
1208                if (ctrl instanceof Catalysis) {
1209                        // Catalysis has its own class
1210                        return ArcClazz.CATALYSIS.getClazz();
1211                }
1212
1213                ControlType type = ctrl.getControlType();
1214                if (type == null) {
1215                        // Use stimulation as the default control type
1216                        return ArcClazz.STIMULATION.getClazz();
1217                }
1218
1219                // Map control type to stimulation or inhibition
1220                switch (type) {
1221                        case ACTIVATION:
1222                        case ACTIVATION_ALLOSTERIC:
1223                        case ACTIVATION_NONALLOSTERIC:
1224                        case ACTIVATION_UNKMECH:
1225                                return ArcClazz.STIMULATION.getClazz();
1226                        case INHIBITION:
1227                        case INHIBITION_ALLOSTERIC:
1228                        case INHIBITION_OTHER:
1229                        case INHIBITION_UNKMECH:
1230                        case INHIBITION_COMPETITIVE:
1231                        case INHIBITION_IRREVERSIBLE:
1232                        case INHIBITION_UNCOMPETITIVE:
1233                        case INHIBITION_NONCOMPETITIVE:
1234                                return ArcClazz.INHIBITION.getClazz();
1235                        default:
1236                                throw new RuntimeException("Invalid control type: " + type);
1237                }
1238        }
1239
1240        /*
1241         * Gets the size of representable Controller of this set of Controls.
1242         *
1243         * @param ctrlSet Controls to check their controllers
1244         * @return size of representable controllers
1245         */
1246        private int getControllerSize(Set<Control> ctrlSet) {
1247                int size = 0;
1248                for (Control ctrl : ctrlSet) {
1249                        size += getControllers(ctrl).size();
1250                }
1251
1252                return size;
1253        }
1254
1255        /*
1256         * Gets the size of representable Controller of this Control.
1257         *
1258         * @param ctrl Control to check its controllers
1259         * @return size of representable controllers
1260         */
1261        private Set<PhysicalEntity> getControllers(Control ctrl) {
1262                Set<PhysicalEntity> controllers = new HashSet<PhysicalEntity>();
1263                for (Controller clr : ctrl.getController()) {
1264                        if (clr instanceof PhysicalEntity && glyphMap.containsKey(convertID(clr.getUri()))) {
1265                                controllers.add((PhysicalEntity) clr);
1266                        }
1267                }
1268
1269                return controllers;
1270        }
1271
1272
1273        /*
1274         * Adds input and output ports to the glyph.
1275         *
1276         * @param g glyph to add ports
1277         */
1278        private void addPorts(Glyph g) {
1279                Port inputPort = factory.createPort();
1280                Port outputPort = factory.createPort();
1281                inputPort.setId("INP_" + g.getId());
1282                outputPort.setId("OUT_" + g.getId());
1283                g.getPort().add(inputPort);
1284                g.getPort().add(outputPort);
1285        }
1286
1287        /*
1288         * Creates an arc from the source to the target, and sets its class to the specified clazz.
1289         * Puts the new arc in the sullied arcMap.
1290         *
1291         * @param source source of the arc -- either Glyph or Port
1292         * @param target target of the arc -- either Glyph or Port
1293         * @param clazz class of the arc
1294         */
1295        private void createArc(Object source, Object target, String clazz, Stoichiometry stoic)
1296        {
1297                assert source instanceof Glyph || source instanceof Port : "source = " + source;
1298                assert target instanceof Glyph || target instanceof Port : "target = " + target;
1299
1300                Arc arc = factory.createArc();
1301                arc.setSource(source);
1302                arc.setTarget(target);
1303                arc.setClazz(clazz);
1304                
1305                String sourceID = source instanceof Glyph ?
1306                        ((Glyph) source).getId() : ((Port) source).getId();
1307                String targetID = target instanceof Glyph ?
1308                        ((Glyph) target).getId() : ((Port) target).getId();
1309
1310                arc.setId(sourceID + "--TO--" + targetID);
1311
1312                if (stoic != null && stoic.getStoichiometricCoefficient() > 1) {
1313                        Glyph card = factory.createGlyph();
1314                        card.setClazz(GlyphClazz.CARDINALITY.getClazz());
1315                        Label label = factory.createLabel();
1316                        label.setText(new DecimalFormat("0.##").format(stoic.getStoichiometricCoefficient()));
1317                        card.setLabel(label);
1318                        arc.getGlyph().add(card);
1319                }
1320
1321                Arc.Start start = new Arc.Start();
1322                start.setX(0);
1323                start.setY(0);
1324                arc.setStart(start);
1325
1326                Arc.End end = new Arc.End();
1327                end.setX(0);
1328                end.setY(0);
1329                arc.setEnd(end);
1330
1331                arcMap.put(arc.getId(), arc);
1332        }
1333
1334        /*
1335         * Collects root-level glyphs in the given glyph collection.
1336         *
1337         * @param glyphCol glyph collection to search
1338         * @return set of roots
1339         */
1340        private Set<Glyph> getRootGlyphs(Collection<Glyph> glyphCol) {
1341                Set<Glyph> root = new HashSet<Glyph>(glyphCol);
1342                Set<Glyph> children = new HashSet<Glyph>();
1343
1344                for (Glyph glyph : glyphCol) {
1345                        addChildren(glyph, children);
1346                }
1347                root.removeAll(children);
1348
1349                return root;
1350        }
1351
1352        /*
1353         * Adds children of this glyph to the specified set recursively.
1354         * @param glyph to collect children
1355         * @param set to add
1356         */
1357        private void addChildren(Glyph glyph, Set<Glyph> set) {
1358                for (Glyph child : glyph.getGlyph()) {
1359                        set.add(child);
1360                        addChildren(child, set);
1361                }
1362        }
1363
1364        /**
1365         * Gets the mapping from SBGN IDs to BioPAX IDs.
1366         * This mapping is currently many-to-one, but can
1367         * potentially become many-to-many in the future.
1368         * @return sbgn-to-biopax mapping
1369         */
1370        public Map<String, Set<String>> getSbgn2BPMap() {
1371                return sbgn2BPMap;
1372        }
1373
1374        private String convertID(String id) {
1375                return id;
1376        }
1377
1378}
